description: Installed it on Ubuntu 20.4. It's icon is not part of the "Installed" packages and can not find hos to run this software.

I found the same a Moz. Ubuntu says it has installed _something_ but there is no icon for "Weaver". It also can't be run from the command line and there are not even any files or directories called "weaver" anywhere in my file system.

 This package seems very, very broken. Is there any quality control at all here?

Does not launch
This installs ok - but then appears to do nothing when you click launch.

Works perfectly - if you cannot see the icon in Ubuntu ( I don't see it either ) just type waver in the terminal and it will launch you the app. Hope it will get fixed soon though, don't see the reason to rate it with one star for a minor bug.

waver
Testing for explicit PulseAudio choice...
...and PulseAudio has been explicitly chosen, so using it.
libGL error: MESA-LOADER: failed to open i965 (search paths /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/dri:\$${ORIGIN}/dri:/usr/lib/dri)

summary: Doesn't have a .desktop file and crashes on launch
